text: Lewy body is a substance that stains eosin, and commonly found in Parkinsonâ€™s disease. The main disease associated with the presence of Lewy bodies is Parkinson's disease. Lewy bodies are also present in neurons in dementia with Lewy bodies and the Lewy body variant of Alzheimer's disease, as well as Hallervorden-Spatz syndrome. ==Other websites== *Differention Dementia with Lewy bodies and Alzheimer Category:Nervous system Category:Dementia
title: Lewy body
